reference.title: desc
reference.shortdesc: The <desc> element contains the description of the current element. In elements that also allow a title, such as table and fig, this is used to provide more information than is appropriate for the title. In the xref and link elements it contains a description of the target; processors may (but need not) choose to display this as hover help for a link. In the object element, desc provides alternate content to use when the context does not permit displaying the object.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <fig><title>The Handshake</title> <desc>This image shows two hands clasped in a formal, business-like handshake.</desc> <image href="handshake.jpg"> <alt>The handshake</alt> </image> </fig>
